alert.note: Alert for Elko; Eureka; Lander; Nye; White Pine (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 21 at 12:13AM PDT until August 21 at 1:00AM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall from Tropical Storm Hilary is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, and northeast Nevada, including the following counties, in central Nevada, Nye. In north central Nevada, Eureka and Lander. In northeast Nevada, Elko and White Pine. * WHEN...Until 800 PM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Streams will continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall and on going rainfall overnight. Some low-water crossings may already be inundated, with more low water crossing becoming impassable overnight due to rising floodwater. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water to develop overnight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1212 AM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rainfall. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin within the warned area. Between 0.25 to 3 inches of rain has already fallen, especially over upslope areas of higher terrain. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ely, Eureka, Pinto Summit, Duckwater, Eureka Airport, Diamond Valley, Garden Pass, Blue Eagle Ranch, Hickison Summit, Preston, Grass Valley, Ruth, Lund, Gillman Springs, Kingston, Ely Airport, Austin, Round Mountain, McGill and Manhattan. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Elko; Eureka; Lander; Nye; White Pine
